Over a Terabyte (or roughly 1 trillion bytes) of data      traverse NYU-NET every day!                                         Connect to NYU-NET & the Internet   Connect Your Mobile Device   Connect to NYU Web   Connect to NYUHome   Connect to NYU Libraries Resources        Connect to NYU-NET & the Internet     NYU-NET is NYU's campus-wide, Internet-connected network of computers, computer-related equipment,  and information resources. It is used by University students, faculty, administrators, and staff.  Underlying NYU-NET is a collection of hardware, software, operating procedures, and policies that  define and manage how NYU-based computers connect to each other and to the Internet.    There are a variety of ways to connect to NYU-NET whether you are on-campus or off-campus .  Explore the navigation menu to the left for more information and instructions. ITS also  provides software that will help you protect the security of your  computer and data, and make the most of your NYU-NET connection.    Your NYU NetID and password are your key to most authenticated NYU-NET resources.     Connect Your Mobile Device   Instructions on how to configure a mobile device to access your NYU E-mail, Calendar, and other Google Apps for Education are available at www.nyu.edu/its/google/ .  Note that you will need to set a separate Google Apps password at start.nyu.edu , which is different from your NYUHome password, in order to connect.    Instructions on how to set up an NYU-provided mobile device (e.g., Blackberry, iPhone) are available at www.nyu.edu/its/mobile/setup/ .      Connect to NYU Web   To access NYU Web, the main NYU website, visit http://www.nyu.edu/ .        Connect to NYUHome   NYUHome ( http://home.nyu.edu/ ) is an online service that provides information  and facilitates collaboration, interaction and communication for all NYU students, faculty and staff.  It is a portal to many web-based services and tools. All NYU community members with access to NYUHome  use their NYU NetID and password to log in. For more information and activation  instructions, see the NYUHome Help pages .      Connect to NYU Libraries Resources    Some NYU Libraries resources can be accessed through the Research Tab in   NYUHome . Some online Libraries resources require a  specific proxy configuration, so the subscription resources that NYU makes available to students,  faculty, and staff recognize that you are a part of the NYU community. For more information on  which Libraries resources require NYU-NET Proxy, and instructions on how to  configure proxy settings for your computer, see the NYU-NET Proxy page  of this website.    Page last reviewed: June 1, 2012

Connecting Youth: Digital Learning Research Project - NYU Steinhardt                                                                           NYU       Institute of Human Development and Social Change             Connecting Youth: Digital Learning Research Project                          About the Project                                                  Across New York City, Chicago, and beyond, a group of schools, museums, libraries, and youth programs have come together to implement unique educational innovations based on digital media and connected learning . Spearheaded by the Institute of Play , the Hive Learning Networks , the Urban Libraries Council , the Institute of Museum and Library Services , the Association of Science – Technology Centers , and other collaborative partners, these groups seek out creative and relevant ways to engage young people’s interests, community awareness, and shape their educational outcomes. They have pioneered after-school and summer programs, YOUmedia drop-in sites, Learning Labs , and two schools as part of a growing set of innovations designed to educate youth for the 21 st century.       The Connecting Youth: Digital Learning Research Project is a longitudinal, multi-method study of the youth, educators, and organizations involved in these innovations. The project’s team of twenty-plus researchers hails from universities across the country and brings diverse disciplinary lenses such as sociology, education, information and technology studies, and psychology to bear on our research questions. These include (but are not limited to) the following:    Student-level:       What are the characteristics of youth participating in the study programs and schools (e.g., demographics, socioeconomic status and academic performance)?    How do participants interact with and access digital media and communication technologies in their everyday lives?    How do participants' attitudes, behaviors, and competencies in the area of digital technology and learning change?    How do changes in behaviors and attitudes toward digital technology and learning vary based on program characteristics (e.g. size, cost, pedagogical style and type of activity offered) as well as student characteristics (e.g., gender, race and parent education)?       Educator and organizational-level:       How are the programs understood and implemented in schools and partnering cultural organizations?    What resources do educators draw on in accomplishing their work and what barriers and obstacles do they identify?    To what extent is institutional change evident in relationship to the programs and the networks of innovations that they aim to promote?       The purpose of this research has been to document activities and outcomes associated with these programs, use the findings to provide ongoing feedback to these implementing organizations for formative program improvement, as well as publish scholarship to improve academic and public understanding of the potential role of digital media in supporting youth development and educational outcomes. This research was made possible by the generous support of the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation. Sherman (WSC ’72)  Archivist's Angle: League of Women   December 2014  NYUAA Announces its 2015 Alumni Award Honorees  NYU Department of Environmental Studies Opens at CAS  Alumni Profile: Lauren Singer (CAS '13)  Archivist's Angle: Archaeology at NYU   November 2014  Alumni Day 2014  NYU Leaders: Lisa Yoo Hahn (LAW '89)  Alumni Profile: Rose Levy Beranbaum (STEINHARDT '74, '75)  Archivist's Angle: NYU School of Retail   October 2014  Alumni Day 2014  Alumni Profile: Kieran Kesner (TSOA ’14)  Archivist's Angle: Eleanor Roosevelt and NYU   September 2014  Meet Your New NYUAA President  Alumni Profile: Kweighbaye Kotee (STEINHARDT ’09)  Archivist's Angle: Villa La Pietra   August 2014  Alumni Card PerksConnect App  Alumni Profile: William Silver (DEN '53)  Archivist's Angle: NYU College of Nursing  Reconnecting to NYU: Gladys Citek Peckham   July 2014  NYU GSTEM  NYU Class of 2018  Archivist's Angle: Albert Gallatin  Alumni Profile: Class of 2013   Jan 2010-Feb 2014   Get Social  NYU Alumni Magazine   NYUAA & Alumni Clubs  NYU Alumni Association  NYU Torchbearers   NYU Alumni Global Passport  Global Locations  Abu Dhabi  Accra  Berlin  Buenos Aires  Florence  London  Madrid  Paris  Prague  Shanghai  Sydney  Tel Aviv  Washington, DC   Global Events  Global Clubs  Alumni Profiles   Make a Gift  Contact Us  Privacy Policy  Help and FAQs                                                                              Login     Create an Account     Help                 Sign in with:                                                                April 15, 2015    Root, Root, Root for the Home Team: Varsity Baseball Returns to NYU                  When the NYU Baseball team took to the field against Oglethorpe University on February 13, it was the first time varsity Violets had been on the diamond in more than 40 years. The next day, the team took the second game of a double-header 2-0, for the first NYU baseball win since May 16, 1973. The original team was disbanded a year later in 1974 following a 0-14 season.    Read more...               FEATURE       Meet Brian Levine (GSAS ’03, MED ’08), NYUAA Board Vice President       Dr. Brian Levine (GSAS ’03, MED ’08) is a first-year board member and one of NYUAA Board’s Vice Presidents. In addition to his role with the NYUAA, Levine serves NYU as a young alumni trustee.    Read more...    The Archivist’s Angle       Jazz and Democracy at the Town Hall    By Deborah Shapiro (GSAS ’16)       In honor of April’s Jazz Appreciation Month, it seems apt to highlight one New York City institution connected closely with the genre: the Town Hall. Founded during the fight for women’s suffrage, in later years the space on 43rd Street would offer other avenues for democratic expression—among them, jazz.    Read more...      ABEL PRIZE    Louis Nirenberg (CIMS ’47)          Alumnus Louis Nirenberg, an emeritus professor of mathematics in the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences, was awarded the 2015 Abel Prize. The Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters awarded the prize to him and John Nash of Princeton for their work in non-linear partial differential equations. Photo ©NYU Photo Bureau: Orling .    Read more...    SAVE THE DATE    NYU Alumni and Parents Day 2015       Mark your calendars and plan to join us at the Washington Square Campus for NYU Alumni and Parents Day on Saturday, October 24, 2015. Details will be available soon.    ONLINE NETWORKING    NYU Alumni Networking Event with Brazen Careerist       Register now for the NYU Alumni Online Speed Networking Event on April 29! Participants will be paired with fellow Violets for several seven-minute text-based conversations that will allow you to make a connection, exchange contact information, and build your NYU network.    YOUR IMPACT    Wonder Where Your Gifts Go?       If you’re a donor, do you wonder where your gifts go? Our generous supporters make so much possible every single day. To learn more, visit us here .            ALUMNI PROFILE       Would You Rather: Earn a PhD in Economics or Become a Master of Wine?       Dilek Caner (GSAS ’02) chose both. The founder of Dallas Wine Education Center and one of only 36 Masters of Wine in the United States, Caner will host a one of a kind excursion to Napa Valley for NYU alumni this November.    Read more...    ANNOUNCEMENT    NYU Names Andrew Hamilton 16th President       The NYU Board of Trustees of recently announced the appointment of Vice Chancellor Andrew Hamilton—the University of Oxford’s senior officer, a noted chemist, a Fellow of the Royal Society, and the former Provost of Yale—as the 16th president of New York University. He will officially take up his duties in January 2016.    Read more...    POINT OF PRIDE       World Reputation Rankings       NYU ranks at number 20 in The Times Higher Education World Reputation Rankings, rising seven spots since 2014, and more than 30 spots since 2011.    LAST CHANCE       NYU Alumni Awards 2015       Join President John Sexton, the NYU Alumni Association, and our distinguished honorees for a luncheon and presentation of the 2015 Alumni Awards on Friday, April 24, 2015. RSVP by Friday, April 17 .    ALUMNI VOTED    Scorsese Wins NYU Alumni March Madness       From Hollywood heavyweights to medical marvels to prominent politicians, ‪‎NYU has no shortage of impressive alumni. But who is your favorite famous NYU alumnus/a? Whose name and/or accomplishments make you most proud to be a fellow Violet? The top 32 began their quest for the crown on March 17, and on April 6, Martin Scorsese (WSC '64, STEINHARDT '68, HON '92) was crowned the champion.    BE PART OF THE MOMENTUM       Support a Student       Unlock potential and unleash ambition by supporting a student as part of the Momentum Campaign, an ambitious effort to raise $1 billion exclusively dedicated to generating scholarships.    Learn more about the Momentum Campaign...                                 NYU Trivia      This April, WNYU is celebrating its 65th Anniversary. NYU's first radio broadcast, when the station WJC aired a performance of NYU's Glee Club, was in the spring of what year?    Send your answer to alumni.connect@nyu.edu for a chance to win a limited edition NYU vintage-themed t-shirt!    Congratulations to Amy Langdon (GAL ’94), winner of last month’s raffle. The correct answer: Standford White was the renowned architect who designed the Washington Square Arch.       Featured Events        April 16: Summer Cocktails with Liquid Lab, #NYUAlumniAccess     April 18: Hiking, Brunch & Griffith Observatory Visit     May 9: NYU Day at the Yankees, #NYUAlumniAccess       Read more...       FEATURED BENEFIT    BankAmericard Cash Rewards™         Show your Violet pride with the BankAmericard Cash Rewards™ credit card for the New York University Alumni Association. Apply now!       CAREER DEVELOPMENT      NYU Wasserman Alumni Listserv    Sign up for the NYU Wasserman Center for Career Development’s Alumni Listserv to learn career management and professional development strategies, receive free job postings, get information on exclusive alumni-only events, and stay connected to NYU. To join, log in to your NYU CareerNet account and click Profile > Personal > Privacy. Opt-in to receive weekly events and jobs via email. Select the topic area "Alumni Events and Resources."
